job.title: Data Integration Engineer
job.description: ResponsibilitiesJob Description for Data Integration EngineerTo develop a global lab automation data architecture for the global quality laboratory enterprise, including information system (ELN, LIMS) integration with vendor-independent laboratory work cells. Additional support is needed from industry experts in GMP laboratory information technology, automation integration, and data architecture to achieve these goals.Global Quality Laboratories (GQL) would like to request 12-18 months of support to build a library of device drivers/edge devices for automation hardware to be able to publish/subscribe data to a message queue platform using MQTT protocol.Activities the role will take part to develop and implement our strategy include but are not limited to:Deliverables attributed to proof-of-concept testing/developmentHardware requirements to satisfy process (if applicable) Develop/implement instrument/device connectors/drivers/edge devices Architectural data handling and transfer technologies/solutions Define process execution system requirements and scopeCollaboration with cross-functional teams to implement end-to-end integration from device/instrument to lab systemTechnology RequestedJava, PythonApache Kafka or other messaging queue platformsMQTT or other similar messaging protocolGitBasic QualificationsHighly motivated individual with 2-5 years experience working in a GMP-regulated environmentBS in Engineering, Computer Science related technical field, or equivalent experienceExcellent verbal and written communication skillsStrong understanding of data architecture for message brokers (e.g. Apache Kafka, Azure Edgehub, MQTT Sparkplug B Protocol)Experience with equipment specific APIs or interfaces, and/or web APIs (e.g. RESTful) Knowledge/experience developing drivers, micro-services, and software interfacesAgile software developmentAdditional Skills/PreferencesExperience with Pharmaceutical or related regulated industriesExperience in laboratory operations, LIMS and ELN, laboratory automation manufacturers including but not limited to; Biovia, Thermo Scientific, Hamilton Robotics, Biosero Green Button Go, Molecular Devices SoftMax Pro, Brooks SampleStores, Hamilton Work Cells, Biotek Gen5, Darwin LIMS, SmartLab, LabVantage)Experience with computer software validation requirements and qualification processes and documentation
